_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Policies



Mar-Jac Poultry AL, LLC in Poultry Jasper, Alabama is a poultry processing plant.  This processing plant produces raw poultry products that are ready-to-cook.  The facility strives through its safety, maintenance, preventive maintenance, Hazard Communication Program and PSM programs to maintain a safe environment for its employees and community.  Daily equipment and maintenance checks helps to ensure the equipment is maintained and operated in accordance to the requirements of its Process Safety Management (Program Level 3); thus, reducing the likelihood of an accidental release.  In the event of an accidental release as defined in our PSM program, it is our policy to notify the Jasper Fire Department's Hazardous Materials Team to aid in the response.  



Through these programs and emergency response policies, Mar-Jac Poultry AL, LLC strives for safe operation for the employees and surrounding community.  



Facility and Regulated Substances Handled



At this facility, anhydrous ammonia is used as a refrigerant.  This refrigerant allows for production processes to make ice, cool and store fresh poultry.  The amount of anhydrous ammonia present at this facility is 34000 pounds.  The anhydrous ammonia is in a closed system.  The anhydrous ammonia circulates and re-circulates through the system.



The Five-Year Accident History



There has not been a reportable accident within the last five years and five years prior to the previous submission.  



General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



At this facility is an active Process Safety Management (PSM) system to help ensure that the refrigerated anhydrous ammonia system is maintained and operated in a safe manner.  The PSM system is composed of 13 elements to help ensure the safe operation of its anhydrous ammonia processes.  Equipment is subject to maintenance, preventive maintenance and reviewed to help ensure sa

fe operation of the refrigeration system.  



The Emergency Response Program



In case of a release requiring assistance, plant management would coordinate with the Hazardous Material Team of the Jasper Fire Department in combined response to the accident.   The Jasper Fire Department would be in charge of the emergency.  This response would include public notification and evacuation (if necessary).  Plant personnel receive training and practice to the facilities emergency response procedures.



Planned Changes to improve Safety



This facility uses the PSM system, training, maintenance and preventive maintenance of the system to make decisions on how to improve safety.  Safety of the employees and community is a concern when decisions are made concerning the maintenance, purchase and installation of new equipment.
